title: Sony executives tell Daniel Craig to ‘shut up’ for bashing James Bond movie
text:
Other Articles Study sheds light on culinary habits of Stonehenge builders 'Fantasy Island' to get reboot with female protagonist Leonardo DiCaprio to make movie on Volkswagen scandal Daniel Craig has been asked by Sony executives to clamp up after saying that he’d “rather slash his wrists” than play James Bond again.
According to a newspaper, Sony executives have told the 47-year-old Daniel Craig to shut up and stop bashing James Bond. It is said that there were problems while re-shooting some scenes at the set prior to the release of the film, The Independent reports.
A source said that Craig was injured on the set and needed knee surgery, and they were still doing re-shoots last month.
Earlier, Daniel Craig, who plays James Bond in ‘Spectre,’ said that he would rather break a glass and slash his wrists than do another ‘Bond’ film, adding that all he wanted to do was move on.
 14, 2015 10:10 pm
